result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig D. Grim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  Stay current on child support obligations.  Maintain full-time employment.  If unemployed, seek employment at the rate of five jobs per week and report search results every other week to the Child Support Agency.  Send letter of apology to son with letter to be routed through agent.  Submit to AODA and treatment.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or enter into any bars or taverns.  Submit to test on demand of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.  

As a further condition of probation, Defendant to submit to the booking/fingerprinting at the Richland County Sheriff's Department by the close of business on Friday, October 31, 2014.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig D. Grim

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 1 document provided for 2 cases - scanned and stored in 14CT34

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal for status in 14CF48, 14CT34 and 14TR1186.  Counsel advise that the parties have reached an agreement and def will be proceeding today with plea/sentencing.  Per the agreement, 14TR1186 is dismissed.  Def pleads no contest to OWI 3rd in 14CT34 and to three amended charges (all now misdemeanors) in 14CF38.  Court's colloquy re pleas.

State has offered probation disposition for the OWI 3rd as well as probation for the failure-to-support case.  BAC was .26 in the OWI 3rd.  

14CT34 - Imposed/stayed jail sentence of 185 days imposed with all but 14 of those days stayed for 2 years probation (sentence imposed) with conditions of $1694 ($600 base), 24 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed, 24 mo IID upon relicensing.  Fine is a condition of probation.  Also:  no possession/consumption alcohol; no bars/taverns; $66 blood draw restitution to be paid for RCSD; test on demand of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.

14CF48 - sentence withheld for 2 years probation with conditions that def stay current on c.s. obligation; if unemployed, seek employment at rate of 5 jobs/wk and report that every other week to CSA; if employed, must maintain full-time or any kind of employment; send letter of apology to son, routed through agent; AODA and treatment; no drink/no taverns/test on demand; costs.  0 days credit.  

Stay of jail requested on the conditional jail time.  Work release/huber for the jail.  Report on or before Nov. 12 between 6-7 a.m.

Condition of probation to get booked in by the end of the week at the Richland County Sheriff's Dept.

ADDRESS INFO for Craig D. Grim
Current: 22730 Badger Ln., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2014)
Prior: 22730 Badger Lane, Richland Center, WI 53581
Status conference on October 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. McDougal for 14CT34 and 14CF48.  Def also has 14TR1186.

In 14CF48, Court notes def's right to prelim.  Atty. McDougal states def waives formal reading and also waives time limits for prelim; asks for status scheduling.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim time limits.  Time periods waiver accepted.

In 14CT34, def pleads not guilty.

14TR1186 - tracking with the other cases - NG plea already been entered.

  Status conference scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
request from SPD to move the initial appearance from Aug. 20 to Sep. 24; no objection from DA
